rComments: Professor Horne is extremely knowledgable and passionate about her subject matter. I really enjoyed this class. Horne is really nice and approachable, and always goes out of her way to respond with personalized and insightful emails or set up appointments. She clearly cares about her students, something I really appreciate at a school this big.

Took this 2 years ago and still reference the concepts learned in her class. Very knowledgeable professor- if something is unclear she explains it in office hours. Material prepares you well for upper divs both cs and prod; heavy on representation theory. Students complaining about her classes are those who don't read the material. Need a smart TA
Inarticulate and rambling lectures.  My least favorite class experience at the University.

The concepts in the readings were genuinely really interesting; the way Horne describes them, not so much. Poor preparation for lectures, little feedback on papers, and don't even think about asking a questions in class, because all you'll get back is a vague answer that some how completely avoids the question. The final was an absolute train wreck

Professor Horne does not know how to structure a class. This was her first time using an online grading method and it turned out to be a complete disaster. I don't think anyone in the class actually read the material besides a small content that was required to complete the online submissions.

This class was a disaster, but it didn't have to be. Film Theory is an important and interesting aspect of the FDM major. Thanks to Professor Horne, Film 120 was worst class I have taken at UCSC. She does not know how to run a lecture, articulate concepts, answer questions, properly address race issues, or grade assignments. She needs to be fired.

Great professor! Jennifer is an incredibly skilled professor who knows her stuff! I enjoyed her class a lot but in order to be successful: spend a LOT of time on your essays (like a day), go to class, EVERY CLASS, take notes what she says is important IS, do most of the reading ESPECIALLY the passages she highlights in class, study for the midterm

Horne was a GREAT teacher. I took this class as a GE requirement outside of my field of major and it was really enriching. She made class very interesting and there was very little work required. To succeed you need to read the "key" passages she mentions in class and write something of actual substance for the papers. Easy A

If you want the A, then be prepared to read for hours on end. The textbook assigned is actually extensively studied and there are multiple websites to clarify some difficult concepts. Overall, you can do well on the test if you read the pages of the quotes in her slides and re-re-re-re read all the assigned texts and pages. Don't skip movie days!

Do not take this class.. complete waste of time. She is not only very unclear, her lectures were based off useless power points with extensive quotes. She is very confusing and lacks originality with her teaching. Entire class failed the midterm.. says something about her. AVOID!

One of the worst professors I have ever had. She has students grade each other which makes no sense because they have no background in video studies. The exams make no sense and she not helpful at all!

If you catch on quickly the class will be easy, however Horne is a terrible professor. She has TAs that are only there to pass out paper. Every lecture I attended put me to sleep. She has tests based on her own interpretation of an abstract book. People who tried and people who didn't got the same grade.

I paid attention in class, slacked off the reading, and still got a good grade. However, class is so boring. Thought it would be fun. WRONG. Don't take this class for a GE. Not even prereq for a Film major. She wastes a lot of time confusing 300 students.

This has been my least favorite class at UCSC (I'm a senior). The essays were easy but instead of having the three TAs grade them they were peer edited. She had a lot of trouble explaining concepts from the book and never gave clear answers which made her multiple choice tests really hard. Save some time and don't take this class.

Students graded the essays which did not make sense since we are competing amongst each other. The midterm median score was a 58% because the 30 multiple choice questions were too subjective. Overall, this class was unfulfilling. While the professor knows about film, her PowerPoints had too many quotes which did not help me understand the book.

Horrible instructor. She doesn't care at all about the students, and refuses to take recommendations from students. The TAs in the class do nothing, pier graded papers, and awful ambiguous tests that are over-weighted. DON'T TAKE FILM 80M!!!!

I thought this class was easy. I did not read almost any of the readings  because she goes over the important points from each reading in class Those points will obviously be on the tests. Short essays are cake. I caught on pretty quick in her style of teaching for this class. What she interprets from the readings are the answers for the tests.

Was hoping to expect a lot out of this class, given that she has taught film at various schools. However, she is terrible- unclear, boring... The peer grading is especially inaccurate and unfair. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

The class was kinda of pointless feeling, and the lectures were a bit boring, but it was VERY easy. The professor was friendly and reasonably helpful. The exam was incredibly easy to pass coming from someone who did none of the reading and only attended about 80% of the time.

PowerPoint-based lectures, slides are too text heavy, doesn't give enough time to take notes, doesn't put slides online. Textbook is archaic and inaccessible to modern audiences. Blames a low midterm average out of 300 students on the U.S. educational system and a lack of studying. Essays graded by peers, some people give low grades for no reason.

At first, was interested in the class as a GE. The book, Understanding Media, is awful. Horne expected us to openly interpret his material, but when were tested, we were confined to a single answer. Average for MT #1 was 17/30 and she blamed the students. Students grade each other's papers; grade subjectivity is wildly variable. DO NOT TAKE.

I took this class because it was recommended for the Film/DM major, and I thought I would love it. But I absolutely hate it! Prof Horne is so vague and confused about the subject itself and makes the students grade each other's essays and makes that the final grade. Then she says we didn't study when the class average for 300 kids was 17/30. >:(

Absolutely pointless class. I thought it would be fun and insightful... The professor was unclear, unhelpful, and rude. Very hard tests, no lectures or practice tests  made available on-line to study and having my classmates grade my paper and that being (practically) the end grade is ridiculous.  This class is not worthy of taking, even as a GE.

I thought this would be an easy class, but it is not. The professor tries to explain what McLuhan is saying, but she gives her own opinion and is not clear on it. class is confusing. She makes other students grade papers and students are mean. she seems confused in her own lecture as well and can't answer questions. She treats students inferior.

If you love film and media, please do NOT take this class. She waste a lot of time repeating, stating obvious and useless things. This class is morally based on facts rather than opinions even though it satisfies the IM part of GE. She lets the students/peers grades the essays that she assigns and she ends up giving you that grade.

you guys just did not study. well lady, that's right you don't get to be a professor. When the class average on the midterm was 17/30 and the class has 300 people in it, its your fault. She is vague and treats the class like we are stupid. I took it for a GE and now will have to fight to pass
She wastes so much time

Jenny is an extremely intelligent professor and deserves all the credit she can get. The class was kind of a BS subject, so if you're really good at justifying your points, the papers will be a breeze (and actually kind of fun.) Just try to engage with the course and you'll be good. ALSO, she is VERY helpful with papers, so ask for help.

Jennifer is really nice and knows her stuff, but her class was soooo boring! People were falling asleep every lecture. However! She made the final really easy because she wanted us to focus on our final paper more than a stupid test, so that was great. She is realistic/understanding of students, but some of the content is dull and seems pointless.
